5619F6A0DFE8013106DB68A86D17958E.description: Students recognize that physical activity provides opportunities for enjoyment, challenge, self-expression, and social interaction.

5619B110DFE8013106DA68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate respect for individual differences and similarities in others in physical activity settings.

56197690DFE8013106D968A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate an understanding of individual differences and similarities in physical activity settings.

56193C10DFE8013106D868A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate sportsmanship, cooperation, teamwork, and conflict resolution in physical activity settings.

56190130DFE8013106D768A86D17958E.description: Students recognize and use safety principles and follow the rules, procedures, and etiquette in physical activity settings.

5618C430DFE8013106D668A86D17958E.description: Personal and Social Behavior: Students demonstrate personal and social responsibility, understand the benefits of physical activity, and respect diversity among people in physical activity settings.

56188630DFE8013106D568A86D17958E.description: Students participate in a variety of physical activities for enhancing the development of muscular strength, muscular endurance, cardiovascular endurance, and flexibility.

561843E0DFE8013106D468A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate an understanding of the health benefits of being physically active.

5617F940DFE8013106D368A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate an understanding of fitness and the principles that govern fitness.

5617B8E0DFE8013106D268A86D17958E.description: Fitness: Students demonstrate fitness literacy and behaviors associated with it.

56177800DFE8013106D168A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate and identify movement concepts that reflect an understanding of effort (time, force, flow), space (location, direction, level, pathway, extensions), and relationships (with objects, with people).

561736B0DFE8013106D068A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate and identify body control skills including turning, twisting, rolling, balancing, transferring weight, landing, stretching, and curling.

5616F420DFE8013106CF68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate and identify object control skills to include throwing, catching, kicking, trapping, striking, volleying, ball rolling, and dribbling.

5616B0C0DFE8013106CE68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate and identify locomotor skills to include walking, running, leaping, hopping, jumping, skipping, galloping, and sliding; and chasing, fleeing and dodging.

56166100DFE8013106CD68A86D17958E.description: Movement: Students demonstrate competency in movement forms and apply movement concepts and principles to the learning and development of motor skills.
